acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.018mg/L of Crustacea (Mysid shrimp) (CICAD62, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as outside of Category since there were the data (ATSDR (2002)) that the half was lethal at 15800mg/kg in rats.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Since the mean of five rat oral LD50 data (CICADS 62 (2004)) were 1523mg/kg, it was set as Category 4.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: We could not find the competent evidence for human. As dynamic viscosity applies to Category 1, 2, however, the principal component is polyaromatic compound, and it is not a substance which has statements of chemical pneumonia in ICSC. We cannot classify it for the dearth of information.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was set as "Category 1B" from the judgment result of IARC: 2A, Occupational Health Society: 2A, EPA: B1, and EU: Cat.2.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1, and rapid degradability and bioaccumulation potential are unknown.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 4 because of its flash point: 60 to 93degC

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The result of the in vivo test of mouse somatic cells (a bone marrow micronucleus, splanchnic organizations DNA adduct) was positive (CICADS 62 (2004)), however, there was no In vivo test result about the reproductive cell. So we classified it as Category 2.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: There is data that the ignition points is 330 - 500 degC, and it is thought that it does not ignite in room temperatures.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since increase of brain tumor and neuroplastoma was suggested to the posterity of the male laborers who received creosote exposures (CICADS 62 (2004)), it is classified into "Category 1A."

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: There is no data on respiratory sensitization.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is one report that stimulative is in rabbit eye. But it had recovered within seven days (CICADS 62 (2004)). So it was set as "Category 2B."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There were differences in the result according to the creosote material coal place of produc. But there was a report of moderate stimulation about the American product (ATSDR (2002)), it was classified as Category 2.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: There is allergic reactions reports of humans about skin sensitization. The hypersensitivity against  ultraviolet lights is also mentioned (CICADS 62 (2004)). It was referred to as Category 1, based on these information.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: There is the information (Merck (13th.2001)) that is substantially insoluble in the water, and it is thought that there is no intense reaction with water.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (lung, liver, kidney, blood)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There is no crucial impact at oral 50mg/kg/day (15w) in rats (within the range of the guidance value Category 2) (CICADS 62 (2004).). Since the histiocytoses of lungs, increase of weight of liver and the kidney (male) and blood (reduction of red corpuscles and hemoglobin, increase in a reticulocyte) were seen in the examination of mist inhalation (ATSDR (2002)) in guidance value within the limits of 2, it was classfied to as "Category 2 (lungs, liver, kidney, blood)."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Narcotic effects, Respiratory tract irritation
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause respiratory irritation (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since the anesthetic actions was seen by test in animal rats (CICADS 62 (2001)) and there was information on the human respiratory irritation (HSDB (2003)), it is classified into Category 3.
